Key Arguments: Distrust in government and organizations like TGA, AHPRA, AMA, and legacy media.
Belief that many conspiracy theories related to COVID-19 have been proven true.
Criticism of the handling of COVID-19 information, particularly regarding ivermectin and mRNA vaccines.
Perception of bias in media, especially the ABC, in favor of government and pharmaceutical companies.
Concern over the suppression of scientific debate post-2019.
Skepticism about the qualifications and impartiality of fact-checkers.
Main Themes: Criticism of scientific and media practices
Notable Quotes: The last three years has taught me not to trust my Government both locally, federally and organisations such as TGA, AHPRA, AMA and Legacy Media to name a few.

The previous three years have been littered with information classed as conspiracy theories primarily in connection with C19 and yet almost every one of these conspiracies have been scientifically proven to be factual.
If we are to believe a misinformation/disinformation bill will be better than what we have currently, please explain why the situations above were allowed to thrive unchecked.
